page.title: 13LIFE STYLES
page.content: We asked people how many cars they had or if they had ,if they had one,or if they travelled by bus to do their shopping. Some of the older people do not have cars, but quite a lot of familes have two cars. The young people used bicycles a lot. We asked people where they shopped for groceries, clothes and larger items like furniture and electrical goods. Most people did most of their shopping in Cirencester, though others went to Chelterham or Swindon for big items. The nearest small grocer's shop is in Bibury. Everybody we asked had a telephone,and quite a lot of people had two. Everybody had a fridge and nearly everybody had a washing machine, though fewer people had freezers and video-recorders and very few had dish-washers.
